Pre-Game Insights: Germany enters this knockout stage with a renewed sense of confidence, having banished the demons of their last two World Cup campaigns, which ended in premature group-stage exits.
Julian Nagelsmann’s men topped Group A, securing their place in the last 16 with dominant performances, including a 7-0 aggregate scoreline against Scotland and Hungary.

Despite a slight scare against Switzerland, where they were on the brink of losing their top spot, Niclas Fullkrug’s injury-time equalizer ensured Germany finished as group winners, avoiding a last-16 battle with reigning champions Italy.
Denmark’s journey to the knockout stages was less straightforward. The Scandinavian side finished second in Group C, a group notorious for its low-scoring matches.
With only seven goals scored across six games, Denmark managed three draws against England, Slovenia, and Serbia, which was enough to secure their progression.
This achievement marks the first time Denmark has reached the knockout stages in back-to-back Euros, highlighting their growing consistency on the European stage.
